intro: Homalium hainanense, commonly known as Hainan wild gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the island of Hainan in China and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
